head.title: Metromedia to Acquire A California Company

hedline.hl1: Metromedia to Acquire A California Company

abstract.p: Metromedia of White Plains, NY, plans to acquire California-based SiteSmith Inc, which provides fiber-optic infrastructure to businesses, in all-stock deal valued as high as $1.5 billion (S)

block.p: Metromedia, a White Plains-based company that provides fiber-optic infrastructure to businesses, announced plans to acquire the California-based SiteSmith Inc., in an all-stock deal that could be valued as high as $1.5 billion.

The exact price will depend on Metromedia's stock value at the end of the year, when the deal is expected to occur. SiteSmith provides comprehensive Internet infrastructure management. The acquisition will allow Metromedia to provide those services in-house rather than contracting them out. Metromedia has about 1,100 employees worldwide, with about 350 in White Plains, a company spokeswoman, Kara Carbone, said.

Metromedia, a White Plains-based company that provides fiber-optic infrastructure to businesses, announced plans to acquire the California-based SiteSmith Inc., in an all-stock deal that could be valued as high as $1.5 billion.

The exact price will depend on Metromedia's stock value at the end of the year, when the deal is expected to occur. SiteSmith provides comprehensive Internet infrastructure management. The acquisition will allow Metromedia to provide those services in-house rather than contracting them out. Metromedia has about 1,100 employees worldwide, with about 350 in White Plains, a company spokeswoman, Kara Carbone, said.
There are no plans to move any of SiteSmith's 400 employees to White Plains. In March, Metromedia said it expected to create more than 560 jobs in White Plains this year.
